verses.verse: By great force my garment is disfigured; It binds me about as the collar of my coat.
He has cast me into the mire, And I have become like dust and ashes.
“I (Job 19:7) cry out to You, but You do not answer me; I stand up, and You regard me.
But You have become cruel to me; With the strength of Your hand You (Job 10:3; 16:9, 14; 19:6, 22) oppose me.
You lift me up to the wind and cause me to ride on it; You spoil my success.
For I know that You will bring me to death, And to the house ((Heb. 9:27)) appointed for all living.
“Surely He would not stretch out His hand against a heap of ruins, If they cry out when He destroys it.
(Ps. 35:13, 14; Rom. 12:15) Have I not wept for him who was in trouble? Has not my soul grieved for the poor?
(Job 3:25, 26; Jer. 8:15) But when I looked for good, evil came to me; And when I waited for light, then came darkness.
My heart is in turmoil and cannot rest; Days of affliction confront me.
(Job 30:31; Ps. 38:6; 42:9; 43:2) I go about mourning, but not in the sun; I stand up in the assembly and cry out for help.
(Ps. 44:19; 102:6; Mic. 1:8) I am a brother of jackals, And a companion of ostriches.
(Ps. 119:83; Lam. 4:8; 5:10) My skin grows black and falls from me; (Ps. 102:3) My bones burn with fever.
My harp is turned to mourning, And my flute to the voice of those who weep.
“I have made a covenant with my eyes; Why then should I look upon a ((Matt. 5:28)) young woman?
For what is the (Job 20:29) allotment of God from above, And the inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
Is it not destruction for the wicked, And disaster for the workers of iniquity?
((2 Chr. 16:9); Job 24:23; 28:24; 34:21; 36:7; (Prov. 5:21; 15:3; Jer. 32:19)) Does He not see my ways, And count all my steps?
“If I have walked with falsehood, Or if my foot has hastened to deceit,
Let me be weighed on honest scales, That God may know my (Job 23:10; 27:5, 6) integrity.
If my step has turned from the way, Or (Num. 15:39; (Eccl. 11:9); Ezek. 6:9; (Matt. 5:29)) my heart walked after my eyes, Or if any spot adheres to my hands,
Then (Lev. 26:16; Deut. 28:30, 38; Job 20:18; Mic. 6:15) let me sow, and another eat; Yes, let my harvest be rooted out.
“If my heart has been enticed by a woman, Or if I have lurked at my neighbor’s door,
Then let my wife grind for (Deut. 28:30; 2 Sam. 12:11; Jer. 8:10) another, And let others bow down over her.
For that would be wickedness; Yes, (Gen. 38:24; (Lev. 20:10; Deut. 22:22); Job 31:28) it would be iniquity deserving of judgment.
For that would be a fire that consumes to destruction, And would root out all my increase.
“If I have ((Deut. 24:14, 15)) despised the cause of my male or female servant When they complained against me,
What then shall I do when ((Ps. 44:21)) God rises up? When He punishes, how shall I answer Him?
(Job 34:19; Prov. 14:31; 22:2; (Mal. 2:10)) Did not He who made me in the womb make them? Did not the same One fashion us in the womb?
“If I have kept the poor from their desire, Or caused the eyes of the widow to (Job 29:12) fail,
Or eaten my morsel by myself, So that the fatherless could not eat of it
(But from my youth I reared him as a father, And from my mother’s womb I guided the widow);
If I have seen anyone perish for lack of clothing, Or any poor man without covering;
If his heart has not ((Deut. 24:13)) blessed me, And if he was not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
If I have raised my hand (Job 22:9) against the fatherless, When I saw I had help in the gate;
Then let my arm fall from my shoulder, Let my arm be torn from the socket.
For (Is. 13:6) destruction from God is a terror to me, And because of His magnificence I cannot endure.
“If ((Matt. 6:19, 20; Mark 10:23-25)) I have made gold my hope, Or said to fine gold, ‘You are my confidence’;
(Job 1:3, 10; Ps. 62:10) If I have rejoiced because my wealth was great, And because my hand had gained much;
((Deut. 4:19; 17:3); Ezek. 8:16) If I have observed the sun when it shines, Or the moon moving in brightness,
